fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36603].
  {panel}

Using JQL in the issue navigator, if you auto complete a field and go on to try and search another, it will not auto-complete without quotes around the first result.

h2. To Reproduce
* open issue navigator to advanced search
* type assignee= and choose a name to auto-complete
* continue typing query with "AND " to add an additional field

Auto-complete will show the user picker result and not continue to respond to what you're currently typing

h2. Workaround
Make sure to wrap the first result in double quotes
fields.summary: Auto complete results need to be surrounded by quotes for auto complete to continue working

fields.description:
Dears.

I have an instance of Jira running in our servers, but we are studying to migrate the Jira to the atlassian ondemand cloud.
We started a test instance (one month trial) and I have imported all of our projects to the cloud.
We decide to use only one of this imported projects in the trial phase and in the second phase to use all projects in the cloud.
To do it, I need to test if is possible to export the project, which will be used in the first phase, and to import it again definitively in the second phase (after all projects were imported again from current production).
But when I am testing this approach I got the error 404 in the URL
https://<example>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/views/ExternalImport1.jspa
This error happens when I click on the item "Import External Project" in the menu " Projects".

Please, could someone help me?

Thanks,

Augusto

PS: I follow the suggetion at
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/252021/import-external-project-ondemand-cloud

Jason%20Worley%20%5BAtlassian%5D
Jason Worley [Atlassian] · 2,742 karma · 2 hours ago

From the description, it sounds like the JIRA importers plugin is disabled on your OnDemand instance. Please open a support ticket at support.atlassian.comand we will ensure it is enabled for you.
fields.summary: Import external project ondemand cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36597].
  {panel}

Your function http://jira-python.readthedocs.org/en/latest/_modules/jira/client.html#JIRA.add_user_to_group

contains the line:
`if content.find('class="error">':`

The find command returns `-1` if the string is not found, which registers as `True` and triggers the if-statement.  I assume you want something like:

`if content.find('class="error">') != -1:
fields.summary: if content.find('string'): will always trigger (jira.add_user_to_group)

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Really curious to know whether we can protect one project from another. I don't want the resources from one project to be touching assignments of another project.

Can you please provide me your expert inputs on how this will work?

Regards,
Rakesh Seshan
fields.summary: Protect one project from another
More issues with attaching screenshots - Java throws error due to security after java update - all browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36591].
  {panel}

Consider the case where an issue is discovered in a previously archived version. In this scenario, one would want to set the Affects Version field to that archived version. However, archived versions cannot be selected in version picker fields. The workaround is to un-archive the version, add it to the Affects Version, and then re-archive the version. This adds seemingly unnecessary effort that could be avoided by slightly changing the requirements for archived versions.

One possible solution would be to add another section at the end of the Affects Version drop down list for "Archived Versions", similar to "Released Versions" and "Unreleased Versions". Putting this section at the bottom of the list helps keep it farther out of reach, but still allows one to select archived versions if necessary.

Another possible solution would be to allow manual entry of an archived version, without displaying it in the drop down list.

Allowing project administrators to enable/disable selecting archived versions would be a plus.
fields.summary: Allow adding archived versions as Affects Versions

fields.description: We have recently switched to JIRA On-Demand and have set up Zendesk for our Customer Service front end.  During our testing we were able to successfully link/create issues from Zendesk to JIRA tickets.  Now it seems that it will work for a short period of time after we setup the mapping in JIRA but then will just stop working.   Inside of Zendesk you can see the ticket sharing and the projects that you want to link to but the ticket never gets created.
fields.summary: Zendesk ticket mapping
As a user I want to inline edit issues in issue navigator list view.

fields.description:
In our Project we have defined diffrent versions (1,2,3,4) and Components (A, B, C).

Now when I want to change the Affected Version, Fixed Version or Components field by using the following steps i get an error message (Example :*Version with id '1' does not exists*).

The steps are

1. Open Issue
2. Click on Affected Version field to edit it
3. Type in a Version (in my case i typed 1) -> ComboBox opens and displays all version matching the input
4. Click outside of the editing field to confirm the change
5. Error message is displayed

In the Edit Issue View i can use the steps above to confirm my edit without getting an error
fields.summary: Fixed Version, Affected Version and Components fields in Issue View are not working as in Edit Issue View
Attach snapshots now not working
Issue link to multiple projects instead of link to selected project issues

Hi

When workflow is editing user can edit status used in workflow (change name, description). This change is global and after that status has new name or description. Unfortunately when status is used in many workflows changing status name in one workflow change it in the rest of workflows. 

When status is used in many workflows changing name should be blocked. Please fix this problem.

Regards
Sebastian

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36568].
  {panel}

This improvement request is raised on behalf of our customer through SAC. As quoted below:
{quote}
The scenario where projects will be migrated is as follows:

* Multiple Jira instances exist
* A team using instance A want to move their project to instance B

In this scenario, we expect instance B to be the instance at risk and the instance that may require downtime or outages. We do not expect or accept that there should be any risk to instance A during this work.

All change introduces risk. Forcing us to make changes to project 1 in instance A so that project 2 can be imported into instance B is not acceptable. This introduces risk to:

* Instance A
* Instance B
* Project 1
* Project 2

Furthermore, the stakeholders for project 1 and project 2 will be different. This puts us in a position where the stakeholders for project 1 can block project 2's migration. All of the time spent coordinating these groups and running tests before taking the action has a cost.

In terms of man-hours and billable support costs, this probably quadruples our cost to complete a project migration.

I would understand a toggle solution where we can either limit validation to just the project that we are importing, or the entire instance.

Your export / import solution is already very weak, given the amount of manual work we have to do to prepare an instance for import (custom fields, workflows, permission schemes, etc.) Adding this restriction on top of that does not resolve any issues for us as a customer, and in fact adds cost, complexity and risk to our environment.{quote}

Support has verified that JIRA indeed checking the userassociation for watcher and voter for all projects instead. See the {{UserAssociationParserImpl.java}}

Support ticket:

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-180950
fields.summary: Project import should only validate data from the source project
When upgrading jira from 3.13.5 to 4.4.5 error occurred when parsing your installation dir
Implement "HTML5" image paste

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36561].
  {panel}

The built in "Comment" field has useful properties; it is multi-valued, it tracks who authored and when. But an issue can only have one field that is a "Comment" field.

I propose a new custom field type that behaves like the built-in comment field. We would use it to track check-in comment with our simple clearcase-integration, but I am sure that it will have many other uses where you want to add information, track who made the addition and when. The information should be shown as flow in a separate tab in the view issue screen, just as the comment field does.

Just to be clear: Using the comment field is not an option in this use case - using the comment field would spam that field and make it hard to see normal comments.

Please also see JRA-24421 which unfortunately has been closed as "answered" despite that fact that that issue was a feature request and not a question regarding how to implement it as a plugin.
fields.summary: New custom field type similar to the comment log
Add COMODO High-Assurance Secure Server CA certificate to the keystore
The JIRA issue rest resource should provide a 'browse url' entry
Add the Created vs Resolved Issue Chart in each version release
Created vs. Resolved Chart gadget - Popup data points for Trend of Unresolved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36551].
  {panel}

In previous versions as JIRA 5.0.7 we had the functionality "Back to Search" in the top right of an issue selected from a filter. This was available to tasks and sub-tasks even when clicking in a subtask from a task.

There is a video attached to better explain and here are the steps to reproduce it:

Previously, in Jira 5.0.7:
1) User runs a filter.
2) User could then click a filter list entry to view the entry.
3) From the entry's subtask list, the user could click one of the contained subTasks to view the subTask details.
4) User could then return to the parent entry by clicking the parent entry ID shown in the hierarchy header of the subtask item (shown above the summary).
5) Once returned to the parent entry, the user could click "Return to Search" in the top right corner to return to the original filter results from 1).

In Jira 6.1.4:
After step 4, when the user returns to the parent entry view screen from the subtask item, the "Return to Search" link is no longer available in the top right hand corner.
Users are complaining about this because they are used to navigation back to list like that.
fields.summary: "Back to Search" functionality in Sub-Tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36544].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When accessed via direct URL, even users who are not logged in to JIRA are able to view the JQL results page, and it does not redirect to the login page.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Log in to JIRA, and perform a search
# Copy down the URL of the search result. An example of this from my own instance would be : {{http://10.60.2.107/jira61/issues/?jql=issuekey%20%3D%20TEST-6}}
# Log out, and try accessing the URL

You would be able to view the results page. However, you should not be able to view the search results (as long as the appropriate project permissions are set)

h3. Additional Info

If the 'Detail View' is selected, then the user would be redirected to the login page.
fields.summary: JIRA search page does not redirect user to the login page

I need this to minimize the security risks on sensitive projects, but I want users to be able to communicate.

Now, users are sending the task content in e-mails, this would stop this practice.

I can not use groups to achieve this.

When the project has a custom field of the type Check Box, and the user try to edit the check box, the option seems to be hidden and the boxes seems to overlap. Which in turn makes it difficult for the user to edit. Please refer to the screen-shot attached.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# Click on the pencil icon next to the field in order to edit it
# Tick the check-box at the top
# Accept the edit.

*Workaround*:

fields.summary: Editing Custom Fields' check box selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36540].
  {panel}

When using the Mylyn Task List 3.9.1 plugin and Atlassian Jira Connector 3.2.2 the connector no longer prompts for the user to re-enter a password if it is not valid.

Users use their SSO credentails to logon to Jira which are required to be changed every 3 months.  After such a change, the Task list displays a small warning icon against the jira repository in the Task List View but this is not readily obvious to users.  Previously a dialog was automatically opened prompting for the credentials to be updated.

The consequences of not immediatly updating the password are that the failed attempts to logon to Jira result in too many retries and the user's SSO becomes invalidated.  User must then set another SSO password but can be unaware that Eclipse/Jira has caused invalidity through too many retries and issue can repeat.

Regards, Danny Pearce (daniel.a.pearce@jpmorgan.com)
fields.summary: Eclipse Jira Connector no longer prompts when Jira password has changed
include apache-log4j-extras.jar with jira distribution

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Mouse over an activity's date (below the activity message)
# Notice it it is not a link (it is a span)
# Click the more options button on the top right of the gadget, and click edit
# Click Save
# After the gadget has finished reloading, mouse over an activity's date

*Expected outcome:*
The date is still not clickable

*Actual outcome:*
The date is now clickable (it is an anchor tag)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36525].
  {panel}

A customer recently attempted an import of their BTF data in to OnDemand.

Their environment was as follows:
{code}
     JIRA Build                                    : 6.0#6095-sha1:601557e8c67ba1d610a3be6ada7f17edcd3dfd76
     Build Date                                    : Sun May 19 00:00:00 EST 2013
     JIRA Installation Type                        : Standalone
     Java Version                                  : 1.7.0_13 - Oracle Corporation
// snip memory params
     JVM Input Arguments                           : -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/usr/local/jira/current/conf/logging.properties -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Xms256m -Xmx768m -Djava.awt.headless=true -Datlassian.standalone=JIRA -Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true -Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true -XX:+PrintGCDateStamps -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/usr/local/jira/current/endorsed -Dcatalina.base=/usr/local/jira/current -Dcatalina.home=/usr/local/jira/current -Djava.io.tmpdir=/usr/local/jira/current/temp
     Java Compatibility Information                : JIRA version = 6.0, Java Version = 1.7.0_13

___ Database Configuration _________________

     Loading entityengine.xml from                 : file:/usr/local/jira/current/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entityengine.xml
     Entity model field type name                  : mysql
     Entity model schema name                      : 
     Database Version                              : MySQL - 5.1.49-3
     Database Driver                               : MySQL-AB JDBC Driver - mysql-connector-java-5.1.10 ( Revision: ${svn.Revision} )
     Database URL                                  : jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB
     Database JDBC config                          : mysql jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB
{code}

And somewhere in one of their issue's comments, they had some *NUL* characters:

{code}$ egrep -n '\x00' entities.xml | cat -v
203257:		 0. req self.addDevice(label: ^@^@ (TwoCharId), config:  0x0000: 00016f39                            | ..o9^M{code}

When importing this data in to JIRA + Postgres, a GenericEntityException is thrown, caused by a SQL exception: {code}SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00){code}

I'm not sure what we can do to make JIRA more resilient when encountering NUL characters, or what the "correct" thing to do here is (e.g., keep the NUL characters, discard, rewrite, ...). Alls I know is that it's a difficult error to triage and diagnose for us, let alone our customers.

h3. Workaround

Running the following command over the {{entities.xml}} file from the backup and re-archiving it results in being able to import the data in JIRA: 
{code}perl -pi -e 's/\x00//g' entities.xml{code}
fields.summary: Importing data in to Postgres with NUL characters fails
Date.parseDate in Calendar.js should throw an error when it is passed an invalid month

fields.description:
We have a default project where issues are created and assigned to a default user. we then move the issue into the proper project. The assignee is prevented assignable rights on the new project, this forces us to select a different assignee on move.

the issue is that the default value is -1. clicking Next will make the assignee the default assignee for the target project. clicking the 'assign to me' also works as intended. however, we are unable to typing the assignee box (where the -1 is displayed).

the following error message appears when trying to type or selecting the dropdown box.

'The JIRA server was contact buy has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of the operation.'
fields.summary: Cannot manually change assignee on Move

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36497].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Add a new POP/IMAP mail server.
# Add incoming Mail Handler using the new created Mail Server.
# Set the "Default Reporter" to an active account/user and save.
# Sent a test email by using Inactive User email address to the Mail Server.

*Expected Results:*
The issue will be created, because JIRA should be only using the Default Reporter User/Account to create the Issue, ignoring the Inactive User email address same as an Unregistered Email.

*Actual Results:*
The issue is not created, throwing this error in the logs:
{noformat} 2014-01-14 17:58:14,040 WARN [Mail Aliases] QuartzScheduler_Worker-1 ServiceRunner    a a[10100]: Reporter (xxxx@xxxx.com) does not have permission to create an issue. Message rejected. {noformat}

*Notes*
The issue have been tested with an Unregistered Emails that are sending out email to the Mail Server, yet the issue is created because it uses the Default Reporter account
{noformat} 2014-01-14 17:00:20,055 INFO [Mail Aliases] QuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ServiceRunner    a Sender(s) [unreg_email@xxxx.com] not registered in JIRA. Using configured default reporter 'xxxxx'. {noformat}
fields.summary: Inactive users cannot Create Issue via Email when Default Reporter is set to an Active User

fields.description:
Hi there

I've set up a pop account for receiving email via Jira On Demand. Testing the POP connection works, but when trying to get the mail handler to import mail into a support project (SUP in the Catapult eLearning account) it fails it's test.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Setup external POP mail address / server / password. 
2. Execute test (success)
3. Configure "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue" mail handler.
4. Set to assign incoming mail to default reporter (in this case, Catapult Admin)
5. Test the connection
6. System responds with "The Test Failed. More Details..."

The expectation is that clicking on More Details would give me some clue as to what went wrong. Instead it's blank, other than the "Test Run Results" header.

Any advice appreciated. We did have email working but seem to be having some internal issues. Anything that can be surfaced via Jira would help.
fields.summary: Can't received email / can't debug

fields.description:
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'left' of null 

This happens to me when I open one my filters on hosted JIRA and click on any ticket.

The expected behaviour is a pop-in that shows the ticket.

If i command-click the ticket it opens normally in a new tab without any issues.
fields.summary: JS error when click on ticket in filter view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36490].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The Linked issues section only shows Issue type, Issue key, Summary, Priority, Assignee, and Satatus. There's no way to configure additional columns to show other information.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please allow the configuration of adding/customizing the columns for the Issue Links section.
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-11 at 13.50.41.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36488].
  {panel}

It will be nice to have URL Aliasing support for JIRA.

For example ScrumBoard has a URL - https://myjira.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=239

Instead I would like it to be --> https://myjira.com/secure/MyProjectScrumBoard

This should be helpful in case of large globally distributed teams as it would be easier for people to share the board URLs and remember the URL as well.

fields.description:
Hello Support-Team,

my OnDemand-instance https://centralgestalt.atlassian.net is running unbearably slow on any computer in several high-speed-connected networks. Pages take many seconds to load. In our local Jira- and Confluence-test-instances everything works fine, but we decided to go with OnDemand in our business. 

I guess, the solution is simple. Please increase my memory, as documented here https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/96691/ondemand-performance-unbearably-slow or do whatever it takes to make our instance fast and smooth.

Sorry for creating a bug in here, but the forum comment said, just by creating a ticket, you could offer the solution. 

Thanks for your great product and a fast reply,
keep up the good work!

regards
Stephan Hoehne
fields.summary: OnDemand unbearably slow
Approval of a plan period
Translation tool for issue comments
As a JIRA project administrator I want the ability to change my own workflow if the system admin has allowed me access to that workflow so that I am in control of my project
I want to be able to opt-out of the what's new dialog for-ever and ever and ever and ever again.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36470].
  {panel}

This behaviour should be consistent with the 'View Watchers' badge. 

Current behaviour:
* Browse to an issue
* Click on the badge next to 'Votes'
* I am taken to a new page titled 'Voters' with a list of voters and a chart.

Expected behaviour:
* Browse to an Issue 
* Click on the badge next to 'Votes'
* An inline dialog opens showing a list of users who voted for the issue. 
* If no users have voted for the issue, there is a message 'There are no voters.'
* Clicking away from the dialog closes the dialog
* If I don't interact with the dialog it closes after xx time
fields.summary: Show a list of voters when clicking on the 'View Voters' badge on view issue page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36467].
  {panel}

A JIRA Admin would like to be able to change/configure which of the Overview sections is shown by default when a user opens a project.

Currently, the Project Overview page remembers the section that was last viewed (e.g Overview - Summary, Overview - Issues, Overview - Agile etc.), but there is no way to configure a default landing page view for the project page.

* This can be configurable per project or generally for all projects by Administrators.
* This setting may also overwritten individually as a user preference option if necessary.
fields.summary: Ability to configure/select which overview section is shown by default when a Project is opened

fields.description:
For minutes at a time during the day, the Activity stream will only show non-Jira stream events (structure, bonfire, tempo, etc) and not any Jira activity.  A few minutes later, it will start working again.  This happens regularly and periodically throughout the day.

I'm not sure if its a problem with the Activity Stream gadget itself, or if something is happening on the backend (like reindexing) that makes the search return no results.
fields.summary: Activity stream intermittently shows zero "JIRA" Activity.  Other sources of data (Structure, Tempo, etc are not affected)
Create documentation page for default User Settings

fields.description:
In various spots within the JIRA Web Interface, small Icons (triangles, arrows, etc.) are displayed as "missing unicode characters" (E02A, E02F, etc.).

This occurs on the official JIRA bugtracker (current version 6.2, see screenshots 17.33.54 and 17.36.05) as well as on our companies internal JIRA Agile system (version 5.2.1, see other screenshots)

It happens only on OSX 10.8 & Firefox 26.0, not on Safari or Windows Firefox.

The problem does not depend on the font set within Firefox.

None of my colleagues with similar setups experiences this problem.
fields.summary: Various Symbols in JIRA Web Interface displayes as unknown Unicode characters

fields.description: The activity stream from Jira intermittently becomes unavailable.  Synchronizer updates are shown.  Auto-update is turned on, and manually refreshing does not help.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36442].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in JIRA which allowed unauthenticated users to create files in any valid directory inside JIRA install. In order to exploit this vulnerability, an attacker requires access to JIRA web interface.

This issue only affects JIRA servers running on Windows OS. It is not exploitable on Linux and OSX systems.

The vulnerability affects all supported versions of JIRA up to and including 6.0.3. It has been fixed in 6.0.4.

For more information, see our [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2014-02-26].
fields.summary: Path traversal in JIRA Issue Collector plugin (Windows only)

The vulnerability affects all supported versions of JIRA up to and including 6.0.4. It has been fixed in 6.0.5.

Creating a linked issue from within an existing issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36432].
  {panel}

jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count is ignored if I specify a larger tempMax param for the page.
Assuming limit is 1000, I can use the following url to see all issues on the first page:
http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEdit1!default.jspa?reset=true&tempMax=123456
instead of "normal" http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEdit1!default.jspa?reset=true&tempMax=1500

It does not let you actually edit all issues (it complains after clicking Next), but the main reason for the limit is to prevent excessive resource use on that first page.
fields.summary: Limit for bulk edit issue count bypassed for the first screen by changing BulkEdit.jspa url

fields.description:
We use Jira OnDemand, and we have identified a bug, causing us to notify our consumers of our Project reports to temporarily ignore the double billing issue.

Please see the attachment for more information.

I need a fix for this, or advise of the best process to accomplish how we use Epics, Sub Tasks and Bugs

Janil
fields.summary: Double billing the customer using Jira Projects
